The quills that STRAIGHTSHOT fire=
d launched through the air like
miniature missiles! But instead of being fi=
lled with explosive
ordinance they were sharp and barbed darts that sailed =
at SABERBACK,
hitting him full in the face!

However instead of inflicting =
the massive amount of damage that they
should have inflicted, they just cau=
sed SABERBACK to stumble back for
a moment as he reflexively defended them =
against her onslaught. And so
instead of penetrating his faceplate, they me=
rely bounced off the
shielding he had put into place and fell harmlessly to=
 the ground.

SABERBACK shook his head as he laughed menacingly, =93I am pr=
otected
against your barbs.=94 He said darkly as he pulled out his weapon a=
nd
oriented it on STRAIGHTSHOT and was about to pull the trigger when a
bla=
st sent him spinning to the side!

=93Pick on someone your own size!=94 The=
 voice and the author of the blast
was TORCA as he waded through broken SHA=
RKTICONS to reach STRAIGHTSHOT
and SABERBACK!

in slashing out with his sword, this time in

The =91herd=92 was indeed continuing to thin as the SHARKT=
ICONS fought to

t into the fray, teeth, claw and talon slicing into the

.

In the middle of all of this SKYBYTE stood smiling now as he watched

ks against DINOBOT and the others as well.

There looked to be a small storm over =
VICE GRIP as they piled. There
was confusion over him as the SHARKTICONS we=
re falling into a frenzy
of sorts! Teeth and powerful jaws were gnashing at=
 him as they
attempted to rend his armor plates from his chassis.

Meanwhil=
e at the dead center of the room was the pit over which the
still silent fo=
rm of OPTIMUS PRIME still hung by chains that stretched
high over head and =
fastened to the ceiling of the chamber somewhere.
The pit itself was perhap=
s 40 feet wide traversed by a small yet
sturdy stone bridge.

At the same t=
ime DARK RODIMUS and RODIMUS had fought their way onto
the bridge, both of =
them looking banged up, their armor pitted,
dented, scratched and blasted. =
Yet neither of them seemed to notice it
as they pummeled at each other!

Be=
neath the bridge smoke began to rise as red, yellow and orange
flames licke=
d their way up out of the pit themselves and began to
dance beneath it.

Fr=
om a few meters away SABERBACK paused in his conflict with
STRAIGHTSHOT and=
 more recently TORCA as if he felt something. He
glanced over at OPTIMUS PR=
IME, =93NO!=94 He said. =93It cannot be!=94

Hanging from the chains, his b=
ody now black and seared, OPTIMUS
PRIME=92s optics flickered once and then =
came back on line. However
instead of their normal white or yellow hue they=
 were crimson!
